definitions.definition: going straight up or down from a level surface or from top to bottom in a picture, etc.

examples.text: the vertical axis of the graph
There was a vertical drop to the ocean.

definitions.definition: having a structure in which there are top, middle and bottom levels
passed from one generation to the next

examples.text: 4% of these infections result from vertical transmission from mother to baby.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (in the sense ‘directly overhead’): from French, or from late Latin verticalis, from vertex ‘whirlpool, crown of a head, vertex’, from vertere ‘to turn’.
